bibl.title: Despatch from Alexander G. Clark to William F. Wharton, December 31, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No 8 Consulate General Series, Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia December 31, 1890, Mr Alexander Clark to Department of State
Abstracts of contents: transmitting accounts and returns for the quarter ending December 31, 1890
No 8 Consulate General Series:, Monrovia Liberia December 31, 1890.
To the Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit the accounts and returns of this consulate for the quarter ending December 31, 1890 per the Subformed list of enclosures and I respectfully call your attention to the account of house rent. I have inclosed two (2) quarters my predecessor Hon Mr. E. E. Smith having paid only for the quarter ending June 30th 1890 and Vice Consul Payne did not feel authorized to draw for said end - ending September 30th as you will see per his report September 30th 1890 Dispatch 67 Enclosures

Enclosures & c 1. Digest of invoice book 2. Arrivals and Departures of vessels 3. Record of treasure fees 4. Contingent account and voouchers (10) 5. Sallery - account for the quarter ending Dec 31 1890
Sir: I have the honor to be your obedient servant Alexander Clark United States Minister Resident and Consul General at Monrovia
